meanings.definition: To be sprinkled or scattered in small amounts.
meanings.sent1: The stars smattered the night sky with their twinkling light.
meanings.sent2: She smattered some sugar on top of the freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally smattered salt instead of sugar on the dessert.
meanings.sent4: The artist smattered paint on the canvas, creating a beautiful abstract piece.
meanings.sent5: The rain smattered against the window, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To have a superficial knowledge or understanding of something.
meanings.sent1: He only smattered a few words of Spanish, enough to order food at a restaurant.
meanings.sent2: She smattered some basic facts about the topic during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The student smattered random facts in the essay to make it seem longer.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of the subject was smattered, making it difficult for him to hold a conversation about it.
meanings.sent5: The detective only smattered a few details of the case, but enough to solve it.
